thread.title: Here are 7 maps predicting Thursday's snowfall in the Boston region
thread.title_full: Here are 7 maps predicting Thursday's snowfall in the Boston region

title: Here are 7 maps predicting Thursday's snowfall in the Boston region
text:
Tuesday’s snow is looking like a small preview of what’s to come. But how much snow will Boston get Thursday?
According to several local meteorologists, anywhere from six to 14 inches.
As of Tuesday afternoon, the National Weather Service expected the snow to arrive Wednesday evening and fall until about 7 or 8 p.m. Thursday.
We’ll have a more detailed forecast from meteorologist David Epstein soon, but, in the meantime, here’s a look at a handful of early snowfall predictions for Thursday:
National Weather Service:
—National Weather Service
Meteorologist David Epstein:
Winter isn't over. pic.twitter.com/YxMmSWBy0p
— Dave Epstein (@growingwisdom) February 7, 2017
WBZ:
WBZ Weather Alert: Nor'easter to bring heavy snow on Thursday https://t.co/URVcTlTUvy pic.twitter.com/yUIZ9XW37e
— WBZ Boston News (@cbsboston) February 7, 2017
WCVB:
Significant snowfall likely on Thursday https://t.co/zGuLKFyjoz pic.twitter.com/VuRXRoweMt
— WCVB-TV Boston (@WCVB) February 7, 2017
7News’s Chief Meteorologist Jeremy Reiner:
Snowfall potential for Thursday. Potential is there for a foot of snow across southern New England. #7news pic.twitter.com/Jp2uDQmLMP
— Jeremy Reiner (@jreineron7) February 7, 2017
Fox 25’s Chief Meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz:
Just talked about this with @KevKennedy1025 I'll fine-tune as storm develops. Less to the north in NH/VT/ME pic.twitter.com/nqsuI27AMs
— Kevin Lemanowicz (@LemanowiczFOX25) February 7, 2017
